verses.roman:
mleccha kahe,--hindure āmi kari parihāsa
keha keha--kṛṣṇadāsa, keha--rāmadāsa

synonyms: mleccha—the meat-eater; kahe—says; hindure—unto a Hindu; āmi—I; kari—do; parihāsa—joking; keha keha—some of them; kṛṣṇadāsa—of the name Kṛṣṇadāsa; keha—some of them; rāmadāsa—of the name Rāmadāsa.
translation: "The meat-eater replied, 'Sometimes I joke with the Hindus. Some of them are called Kṛṣṇadāsa, and some are called Rāmadāsa.
